title: Akaliza Keza Ntwari writes on women-led innovation - Fondation Botnar

quotes: Eight years ago Judith Owigar, Angela O. Lungati, Linda Kamau, and Marie Githinji were among the few women working in tech design in Kenya, and so AkiraChix was born out of a conversation that they were – and should not be – a minority.

organizations.name: rAInbow
quotes: rAInbow shares personalised and immersive stories, and uses a chatbot to help to identify signs of abuse in relationships.

organizations.name: AkiraChix
quotes: AkiraChix was born out of a conversation that they were – and should not be – a minority.

With support from Google and the Institute of Software Technology, AkiraChix works with women in deprived areas of Nairobi, including young girls from poor social and economic backgrounds, to teach them skills in programming, graphic design, and technology training and entrepreneurship.

quotes: With support from Google and the Institute of Software Technology, AkiraChix works with women in deprived areas of Nairobi, including young girls from poor social and economic backgrounds, to teach them skills in programming, graphic design, and technology training and entrepreneurship.

organizations.name: Girls in ICT Rwanda
quotes: As a founding member of Girls in ICT Rwanda, I have seen first-hand that widening participation in tech provides more autonomy in tackling the diverse health issues people are facing at the grassroots level.

organizations.name: Fondation Botnar
quotes: Fondation Botnar’s flagship initiatives, supporting cities to develop youth-centred strategies

support millions of people in South Africa who are in abusive, controlling, or unhealthy relationships, which are sadly still a prevailing risk to women worldwide.

Eight years ago Judith Owigar, Angela O. Lungati, Linda Kamau, and Marie Githinji were among the few women working in tech design in Kenya, and so AkiraChix was born out of a conversation that they were – and should not be – a minority.

AkiraChix works with women in deprived areas of Nairobi, including young girls from poor social and economic backgrounds, to teach them skills in programming, graphic design, and technology training and entrepreneurship.
Fondation Botnar, St. Alban-Vorstadt 56, 4052 Basel, Switzerland
